job_title: Federal Student Worker in Glendale, AZ
pros: Easy work, non-stressful, very friendly and understanding employees
cons: No growth opportunity, no real raises or other kind of bonuses or breaks offered

job_title: Public Safety Assistant in Glendale, AZ
pros: Relaxed consistent schedule. Good for a student. Retirement account that matches 1$ for 1$. Job is easy.
cons: Pay is dissappointing. No full time available, they act like its a deep honor/ privilege to get 40 hours, and hold it over peoples heads because they dont want to pay out on the benefits for full time employees.

pros: Loved it! I love the culture at GCC
cons: There were really no cons

pros: The schedule is based on your availability, which is a plus as a student. Performing the job description is simple and can be improved with time and practice.
cons: The pay is lower than desired but at least minimum wage.

job_title: Front Desk Receptionist in Glendale, AZ
pros: Gain experience with flexible hours around class schedule(FWS).
cons: No overtime, weekends,some departments close after 5pm - 8pm.

pros: Great place to work with great benefits.
cons: Years of experience are weighed too heavily.

review_title: Great place to work for students
job_title: Student Office Assistant in Glendale, AZ
pros: Very flexible with your school schedule, the responsibilities assigned give you great starting work experience and a base for other prospect jobs after graduation.
cons: The pay is low, with rising education costs an increase in pay to student workers would be great!

review_title: Good teaching support, flexible schedule choices and modalities
pros: GCC's CTLE department is invaluable for teaching. They help with everything from navigating the LMS to setting up assignments. My department offers me classes that fit into my schedule, and they respect my time at my other job. Faculty reviews are helpful for kudos and feedback... so far I've had 2 in 2 years.
cons: Pro-rated salary for low enrollment... I work just as hard to set up a class, keep it exciting and fresh for 14 students as I do for 24 students... I shouldn't be paid less.

review_title: CloseNet Family of Different walks of IT
pros:
Work closely with every department of IT. 
Beyond Friendly Work Environment.
Opportunity to branch off into desired field
cons: Limited Funding: Work within Budget

job_title: Mental Health Counselor in Peoria, AZ
pros: Great Place to do your go-to school!
cons: I can't think of any!

pros: work around your schedule and lots of different opportunities
cons: most are work-study jobs so part time.

pros:
-It's a good-looking campus with no shortage of students..they will have lots of money coming in for years to come!
-Employee perks, such as a massage every semester and free use of the campus pool and fitness facilities, are great for professors who don't have time to do much of that off-campus.
-Good athletic program, and athletes are required to attend class regularly and participate in campus activities.
-Lots of remodeling going on -- many updated facilities for classrooms, offices, student services, etc.
-Option to teach at GCC North, a satellite campus with impressive amenities (for a satellite campus!)
-Good advisors for students
cons:
-Rampant mismanagement of funds
-Poor feedback
-Uneducated decisions made with regards to hiring, faculty retention, etc.
-Technological services are a bunch of lackeys -- they talk a big game about improving tech support, but rarely follow through.
-Faculty support nonexistent. After orientation in the first few weeks, you rarely, if ever, are given any support from senior faculty or administration.
-Instability with budgets. Money is frequently given, then taken away, in many departments.
-Students lack basic skills. A psychology professor doubles as an English professor because many students do not know how to write a basic sentence, much less put together a research paper.

review_title: Easy work, low pay, no benefits, no possibility of full time
pros: Nice work environment, a lot of freedom, they are willing to schedule my classes around my other jobs. The interview was non-existent. They basically just call you when your number comes up, and ask you if you'd like to teach, and what your best hours are.
cons: There is an extremely low likelihood of ever getting a full time position. The numerous other other adjunct faculty have been teaching for 10 years, and work at 5 different colleges, all as part time. It is worth noting that very few students make it through their first semester and even fewer actually graduate. Ask the other teachers how many students they have by the end of the semester - it's usually 9-15. Also, your planning and grading really eats up your time - after doing the math, it amounted to about $2/hr.

pros: Good coworkers, good benefits, constant opportunity for new learning.  Great feeling at the end of a day helping students progress into the adults they will become.
cons: Too much mistrust of management, too much political infighting.  Huge waste of resources, particularly time and money spent endlessly planning and executing ill-conceived projects.  Work environment is starting to become more toxic than I have ever seen it before.  Limited room for career growth once hired into a position.

review_title: Gelndale Community College is one of the best, multicultural affairs were knowledgeable, ethical and very honest.
pros:
You meet different people from different parts of the world get the experience on how to work with them
if you like to provide resources, and like to communicate in a professional setting with international students, and have the patience to work with them you will enjoy it as I did, it is a once in a life time opportunity. since you go in they greet you and make you feel welcomed.
cons:
It is a temporary job mostly available to federal work study students
there isn't any cons.

pros: Close to home; nice campus; perks include book clubs, lunch-time meditation, wellness lunch and learn
cons: Part-time employees treated as second-class citizens; not included in staff and department meetings, each department must have at least 2 FT employees in place at all times - PT employees not allowed to be left alone while FT at lunch or on bathroom break, not even allowed to park in employee-only parking spots!  Management, from Chancellor on down the chain, is out-of-touch with their employees.  Internal politics is atrocious.  Pay not commensurate with responsibilities and experience.  No such thing as merit promotions.

job_title: Help Desk Support in Glendale, AZ
pros: I worked in the IT Department at the Help Desk and everyone working there was very friendly and easy to communicate with. The job itself allowed me to troubleshoot and help students/staff at a good pace, and I had a wonderful time working there.
cons: I honestly do not have any cons to note about this job, other than the fact that I would've liked to work there full time.

review_title: Its a great school that has many experienced tutors , the tutor position is available if you can pass a math test  .
pros: This job is very flexible and a good environment when its not too busy, no cleaning or demeaning work.Get respect and admiration from other students that need help and advice as they are usually freshman   .
cons: Few hours , most of the time 10-16 per week. The workload can be busy and stressful with all the employees being students not math professionals.

review_title: Good if you can get in which seems difficult.
pros: Great co workers. Good benefits if you can get board approved full time employment.
cons: The internal system for applying for jobs doesn't make employees feel valued. Been trying to get full time work for over four years here, but instead have to look elsewhere.

pros: Many people on this campus are truly amazing and dedicated to the success of the students who attend this college.
cons: I have been at GCC for more than five years and I do not think there is a con.  Employees (faculty, staff, students admins) are terrific and the students are amazing!

pros: Glendale Community College treats the staff with respect, the staff cares about the students and I love that they retain the staff.
cons: I wish there were more opportunities to go from Adjunct to full time staff.

pros: Flexible schedule, decent pay, good coworkers
cons: Poor management, archaic systems, no access to required work materials

job_title: Adjunct English Teacher in Glendale, AZ
pros: Wonderful and friendly people; sprawling open campus
cons: Low pay - especially for English teachers who have to grade papers; no benefits if part-time

job_title: Human Resources Technician in Glendale, AZ
pros: Great pay and flexibility
cons: Terrible coworkers, bad training, and rules only apply to some or constantly changing without notice

pros:
Chemistry Chair is easy to contact, approachable, knowledgeable, and friendly.
Colleagues are intelligent and eager to help each other out.
cons: Honestly, not enough hours. More of a limitation set by the Administration than by the department itself, though.

pros: The staff are friendly and very social, schedules are flexible and hours are easy to get
cons: No Cons, other than not much career advancement opportunities unless an instructor

pros: Flexible schedule, wonderful students, opportunities for personal growth, free/reduced tuition, pleasant campus
cons: Horrible leadership, political in-fighting, cronyism running rampant, extremely low employee morale, lack of resources which creates in-fighting for what resources are available,  the most toxic work environment I have ever seen!

job_title: Senior Administrative Assistant in Glendale, CA
pros: The  Employess and Faculty are fantastic.
cons: MCCCD is in transition - so change is happening & on the forefront.

pros: You can study on Help Desk
cons: Schedule never same and always change.

pros: Flexible schedule, easy job, friendly staffs.
cons: Low wage, boring job, lots of pressure.

job_title: Student Assistant Specialist in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Good environment,great people to learn from.
cons: Need more bonus,more training,vacation time

pros: Nice Campus, friendly staff & students
cons: Pay still low for adjuncts

pros: Nothing, nothing, nothing, nothing and nothing.
cons: Terrible management, rude employees, and barely any pay
